title: Ramp hits $22.5B valuation just 45 days after reaching $16B
description: In 2025, Ramp keeps raising money at increasing valuations as its CEO pursues an AI-powered future.
author: Julie Bort

title: A guide to using Edits, Meta’s CapCut rival for short-form video editing
description: Meta shared that it was working on Edits in January after ByteDance-owned CapCut was removed from U.S. app stores.
author: Aisha Malik

title: How a New Jersey startup found an electrifying way to slash copper costs
description: Still Bright is now loaded up with $18.7 million in seed money to build out its demonstration unit.

title: PlayerZero raises $15M to prevent AI agents from shipping buggy code
description: PlayerZero landed angel investors like Databricks' Matei Zaharia, Dropbox's Drew Houston, Figma's  Dylan Field, and Vercel's Guillermo Rauch, its founder says.
author: Julie Bort

title: Minnesota activates National Guard as cyberattack on Saint Paul disrupts public services
description: Gov. Tim Walz activated the state military's cyber forces to help ensure public services continue to run as the city of Saint Paul battles an ongoing cyberattack.
author: Zack Whittaker

title: Google is using AI age checks to lock down user accounts
description: Google will soon cast an even wider net with its AI age estimation technology. After announcing plans to find and restrict underage users on YouTube, the company now says it will start detecting whether Google users based in the US are under 18. Age estimation is rolling out over the next few weeks and will […]
author: Emma Roth

title: You can hide an AirTag in Skechers’ new kids’ shoes
description: If you’re a parent with kids in school or kids who are independently exploring their neighborhood for the first time, then there’s a good chance you’ve considered stashing a tracker somewhere on their person for added peace of mind. Skechers is making that a little easier with a new line of sneakers for kids that […]
author: Andrew Liszewski

title: DJI finally brings its impressive Amflow e-bike to US trails
description: Starting today, DJI’s Amflow electric mountain bike range is available to buy in the United States. It comes over a year since the showcase for DJI’s very impressive Avinox drive system was launched in Europe, sending shockwaves through the industry and leaving stalwarts like Bosch and Specialized struggling to respond. What’s most impressive about the Avinox system […]
author: Thomas Ricker

title: Ready or not, age verification is rolling out across the internet
description: On July 25th, the UK became one of the first countries to widely implement age verification. Its Online Safety Act requires sites hosting porn and other content deemed "harmful" - including Reddit, Discord, Grindr, X, and Bluesky - to verify that users are over the age of 18. The early results have been chaotic. While […]
author: Emma Roth

title: Microsoft is getting ready for GPT-5 with a new Copilot smart mode
description: I reported last week that OpenAI is planning to launch GPT-5 in early August, as part of an effort to simplify and combine its large language models. Just a day after my report, references to GPT-5 were spotted inside Microsoft's Copilot web app, hinting at a new smart mode. Sources familiar with Microsoft's AI plans […]
author: Tom Warren

title: Is Roman concrete more sustainable? It’s complicated.
description: Roman concrete produces as much, if not more, CO2 as modern concrete, fewer air pollutants.
author: Jennifer Ouellette

title: India safely launches a $1.5 billion satellite for NASA
description: "We are at the threshold of fulfilling the immense scientific potential NASA and ISRO envisioned."

title: Australia’s first orbital-class rocket stalled seconds after liftoff
description: "I thought best case was maybe 40 seconds of flight time, but I'll take 14 as a win."

title: Google confirms it will sign the EU AI Code of Practice
description: The company is not looking to make new enemies in Europe.

title: The AI Hype Index: The White House’s war on “woke AI”
description: Separating AI reality from hyped-up fiction isn’t always easy. That’s why we’ve created the AI Hype Index—a simple, at-a-glance summary of everything you need to know about the state of the industry. The Trump administration recently declared war on so-called “woke AI,” issuing an executive order aimed at preventing companies whose models exhibit a liberal…
author: The Editors

title: An EPA rule change threatens to gut US climate regulations
description: This story is part of MIT Technology Review’s “America Undone” series, examining how the foundations of US success in science and innovation are currently under threat. You can read the rest here. The mechanism that allows the US federal government to regulate climate change is on the chopping block. On Tuesday, US Environmental Protection Agency administrator…
author: Casey Crownhart

title: The Download: a 30-year old baby, and OpenAI’s push into colleges
description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Exclusive: A record-breaking baby has been born from an embryo that’s over 30 years old A baby boy has just won the new record for the “oldest baby.” Thaddeus Daniel Pierce, who arrived…
author: Rhiannon Williams

title: Exclusive: A record-breaking baby has been born from an embryo that’s over 30 years old
description: A baby boy born over the weekend holds the new record for the “oldest baby.” Thaddeus Daniel Pierce, who arrived on July 26, developed from an embryo that had been in storage for 30 and a half years. “We had a rough birth but we are both doing well now,” says Lindsey Pierce, his mother. “He…
author: Jessica Hamzelou

title: OpenAI is launching a version of ChatGPT for college students
description: OpenAI is launching Study Mode, a version of ChatGPT for college students that it promises will act less like a lookup tool and more like a friendly, always-available tutor. It’s part of a wider push by the company to get AI more embedded into classrooms when the new academic year starts in September. A demonstration…

title: Show HN: Use Their ID – Use your local UK MP’s ID for the Online Safety Act
description:
Hi HN - 
I made a site that takes a UK postcode, grabs the local MP's information and generates an AI mockup of what their ID might look like.It's a small, silly protest at the stupidity of the Online Safety Act that just came into force.edit - My open AI credits got hugged to death, please use a known postcode (like one from Kier Starmer's constituency, WC2B6NH) in the meantime.

Points: 832
